newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil confirms eyeing CPMF exemption for stocks.
newsitem.headline: Brazil confirms eyeing CPMF exemption for stocks.

text.p: Brazil's Finance Ministry confirmed it is studying whether to exempt stock trade from the new 0.2 percent CPMF tax on financial tranactions.
A spokeswoman for ministry Executive Secretary Pedro Parente said the possible exemption was being analyzed by the government officials.
Local share prices have risen Tuesday and today on speculation the government will exempt stock transactions from the so-called "check tax" in a bid to avoid capital flight as a result of the levy.
The CMPF is designed to raise some 400 million reais a month to fund health services.
Parente, speaking to reporters in Congress, was reported to have said there is "not the slightest chance the CPMF won't be implemented."
The tax is expected to be levied on all financial transactions after January 23.
